Others: Javier Sanoja, the Miami Marlins No. 14 prospect, made his Major League debut and recorded an RBI on Saturday, followed by two hits in his first start on Sunday.
Sanoja, who is only 5-foot-7, demonstrated a simple right-handed stroke and put the ball in play to all fields.
In his debut, Sanoja crushed a hanging slider to the right-center gap for a leadoff double and later pulled a two-strike changeup for an RBI single.
Sanoja's sprint speed was 28.9 ft/sec when he scored from first base during the seven-run fourth inning.
Manager Skip Schumaker praised Sanoja's performance, stating that he doesn't punch out and made Johnson beat him.
Sanoja made his debut as a pinch-hitter on Saturday and became the youngest Marlins position player to debut since teammate Jose Devers in 2021.
Sanoja started at shortstop in the eighth inning of Sunday's game and his teammates celebrated his performance after the final out.
